geninfo.para: Adjusting the Hood/Fender assembly on 9200 and 9400 Models built after July, 1996, to get the proper fit with the cab cowl is accomplished by adjustments made at the hood hinge bracket, rear hood guide on each side of the hood, rear hood guide support on each side of the chassis, center hood guide support at the center of the cowl and center hood guide at the center of the hood. Use the following procedure to adjust the hood/fender assembly to meet the 3/4 inch spacing specified and to align the hood with the cab cowl, at the top and both sides.

note.para: After July 1996, the 9200 and 9400 hood hinge bracket is not adjustable up or down; the gap between the bottom front edge of the hood and the top of the bumper is now fixed.

svcprocinfo.para: Before starting this procedure, be sure the vehicle is setting on a level surface, the cab is square on the chassis and the cab air ride is adjusted. Refer to GROUP 16 in the CTS-5000 Master Service Manual for cab squaring and cab air ride adjustment procedures.

svcsubproc.title: Rear Edge of the Hood Too Close to the Cowl

step1.para: Make 4 wood spacer blocks that are sized 3/4 x 1.0 x 24.0 inches (19 x 25.4 x 609.6 mm).

Remove 4 grille mounting nuts (Item 1, Figure 1), 2 each side, and remove the grille (Item 2, Figure 1) before adjusting the hood. This will allow access to the 3 hinge bracket adjustment bolts (Item 3, Figure 2). The nuts (Item 4, Figure 2) are welded to the bottom of the hinge bracket mounting plate (Item 5, Figure 2).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Position 2 of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks on the cowl flange ( Figure 3). Use the other 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks to check the hood-to-cowl spacing on each side.

Reach through the grille opening and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the 3 hinge bracket adjustment bolts (Item 3, Figure 2) and push the hood forward (Item 2, Figure 2) at the hinge bracket (Item 1, Figure 2).

Close the hood so the rear edge of the hood rests against the front of the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks. Make sure the spacer blocks are equally spaced and setting on the cowl flange, then latch the hood on both sides.

With the hood resting against the hood-to-cowl spacer blocks and the hood-to-cowl dimension properly set, check the hood-to-cowl spacing on each side with the other 2 spacer blocks, then check for equal spacing between the cowl flange and the inside edge of the hood. Tighten the 3 hinge bracket adjustment bolts (Item 3, Figure 2).

Once the hood is properly adjusted and the hood closed and latched on each side, position the grille (Item 2, Figure 1) in place over the 4 studs, 2 each side, and install the 4 mounting nuts (Item 1, Figure 1).
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Remove the 2 hood-to-cowl spacer blocks from the cowl flange.
Close and latch the hood on both sides.

svcsubproc.title: Top of the Hood Too Low or High at the Cowl

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, reach under the fender and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, 2 adjustment bolts (Item 5, Figure 4) at the front of the mounting bracket (Item 6, Figure 4).

Reach under the fender and through the opening in the splash guard (Item 2, Figure 4), and run the adjustment bolt (Item 7, Figure 4) up or down to raise or lower the hood guide support (Item 1, Figure 4) so the top of the hood is at the same height as the cab cowl ( Figure 5).
Once the hood and cab cowl are at the same height ( Figure 5), tighten the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 5, Figure 4).
Repeat procedure for other side of the vehicle.

It may be necessary to adjust the rear hood guide (Item 2, Figure 6) up or down along with adjusting the rear hood guide support (Item 1, Figure 4) to make the hood and cowl the same height. If required, adjust the rear hood guide as follows.

calloutgroup.callout1: 7. ADJUST IN DIRECTIONS OF ARROW UP OR DOWN

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly enough to adjust the rear hood guide (Item 2, Figure 6).

Loosen, but do not remove, the 3 adjustment bolts (Item 1, Figure 6) that secure the rear hood guide (Item 2, Figure 6) to the inside of the hood. Adjust the rear hood guide up or down (Item 7, Figure 6) on the slotted holes, as required, to make the top of the hood the same height as the cowl.
Hold the rear hood guide (Item 2, Figure 6) in place and tighten the 3 adjustment bolts (Item 1, Figure 6).
Repeat this procedure for the other side, if necessary.
Lower the hood to the closed position and latch the hood on each side. Check to see that the top of the hood is the same height as the cowl ( Figure 5). Repeat if necessary.

svcsubproc.title: Align the Side of the Hood With the Side of the Cowl at the Hood Guide Support

step1.para: With the hood closed and latched, reach under the splash guard and through the opening in the splash guard (Item 2, Figure 4), and loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 3, Figure 4) holding the hood guide support (Item 1, Figure 4) to the hood guide support bracket (Item 4, Figure 4).
Reach under the fender and push the hood guide support (Item 1, Figure 4) in or out, as required, until the rear edge of the hood is even with the side of the cab.

With the rear edge of the hood even with the side of the cab, hold the hood guide support (Item 1, Figure 4) in place on the hood guide support bracket (Item 4, Figure 4) and tighten the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 3, Figure 4).
Repeat procedure for other side of the vehicle.

svcsubproc.title: Align the Side of the Hood With the Side of the Cowl at Center Hood Guide Support

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.

Loosen (to finger tight), but do not remove, 3 adjustment bolts (Item 2, Figure 7) that secure the center hood guide support (Item 1, Figure 7) to the cowl. Close and latch the hood. Push the upper hood side to side to align the upper hood sides with the side of the cowl.
Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.
Hold the center hood guide support (Item 1, Figure 7) in place and tighten the 3 adjustment bolts (Item 2, Figure 7).

It may be necessary to adjust the center hood guide (Item 1, Figure 8) side to side along with adjusting the center hood guide support (Item 1, Figure 7) to align the upper sides of the hood with the side of the cowl. If required, adjust the center hood guide as follows.

svcsubproc.title: Align the Side of the Hood With the Side of the Cowl at Center Hood Guide

step1.para: Release the hood latches on each side of the hood and tilt the hood assembly to full open position.

Loosen, but do not remove, the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 2, Figure 8) that secure the center hood guide (Item 1, Figure 8) to the inside of the hood. Adjust the center hood guide side to side on the slotted holes, as required, to align the upper sides of the hood with the side of the cowl.
Hold the center hood guide (Item 1, Figure 8) in place and tighten the 2 adjustment bolts (Item 2, Figure 8).

Lower the hood to the closed position and latch the hood on each side. Check the alignment of the upper sides of the hood with the sides of the cowl. If further adjustment is necessary to achieve the proper position of the hood with the cowl, repeat this procedure.
